contentrichtext.text: '''CineMagic''' is the name of a film process invented by [[Norman Maurer]] and [[3-D movie]] producer [[Sidney W. Pink | Sid Pink]] for the 1959 science-fiction film ''[[The Angry Red Planet]]'' to cast a red glow over scenes depicting the surface of Mars. The low-cost process made the actors look similar to cartoon drawings so they would fit in with low-budget, less realistic [[Theatrical_scenery | sets]] and [[Theatrical_property | props]]. To achieve this effect, a [[Black_and_white_film | black and white]] [[Film_negative | film negative]] was first processed with [[solarisation]] (a process which partially reverses the negative making some areas of the image appear positive). The resulting film was then [[Film_tinting | tinted]] red. Making a film positive was not necessary. At the time ''[[The Angry Red Planet]]'' was produced, black and white film cost less than color film and processing. The combination of using black and white film for all scenes depicting Mars and not needing to produce a film positive lowered production costs for the film.<ref>{{cite web|last=James|first=Bacon|title=New Picture Process Made|url=http://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=1842&dat=19590907&id=iBosAAAAIBAJ&sjid=4MYEAAAAIBAJ&pg=4491,763658|work=Times Daily - Sep 7, 1959|publisher=Times Daily}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=David|first=Hayes|title=The Last Interview with Sid Pink|url=http://voices.yahoo.com/the-last-interview-sid-pink-467.html|publisher=Yahoo!}}</ref> == References == {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0684335/ Sid Pink] at [[IMDB]] * [http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0560816/ Norman Maurer] at [[IMDB]]. * [http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0052564/ Angry Red Planet entry with images of CinemMagic effect] at [[IMDB]] [[Category:Special effects]]
